definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: He never fails to astound us with his ability to dunk a basketball backwards without looking.
sentences.chinese: 我們總是驚訝於她不回頭看就能背投中的扣籃技術。

sentences.english: Doctor J's dunks were wondrous to the eye.
sentences.chinese: 博士的扣籃讓人歎爲觀止。

sentences.english: This Dunk Hi Supreme is now available at Atmos .
sentences.chinese: 至尊這的扣籃喂現在是可利用的在大氣。

sentences.english: The man that made the windmill and the between the legs dunk popular.
sentences.chinese: 他讓大風車和雙腿之間的扣籃成爲流行。

sentences.english: This was the first time I saw Scola dunking on the game.
sentences.chinese: 這是我第一次看斯科拉在比賽中扣籃。

sentences.english: I can remember you a lot of shooting, drive and dunk approach.
sentences.chinese: 我可以牢牢記住你很多的投籃，上籃和扣籃的方式。

sentences.english: Slam dunking a basketball is a fight against gravity.
sentences.chinese: 扣籃是需要與地心吸力對抗。

sentences.english: In my dreams, I can dunk .
Emeka Okafor admitted he wasn't expecting Kobe Bryant to try to dunk over him.
sentences.chinese: 奧卡福承認他沒有想到科比會想在他頭上扣籃。

sentences.english: Philadelphia 76ers steal ball and Iverson slam for 2.
sentences.chinese: 費城76人隊爭到球，艾弗森扣籃得2分。

sentences.english: You are dunked underwater, where you blow out even more air.
sentences.chinese: 你是扣籃水下，在那裏你吹出來，甚至更多的空氣。

sentences.english: With such a slam-dunk, he got the champion for slam-dunk.
sentences.chinese: 也憑藉這個扣籃一舉拿到了當年扣籃大賽的冠軍。

sentences.english: With such a slam-dunk, he got the champion for slam-dunk.
sentences.chinese: 也憑藉這個扣籃一舉拿到了當年扣籃大賽的冠軍。

sentences.english: I used to just try to jump and try to dunk.
sentences.chinese: 我就是經常嘗試跳起來扣籃。

sentences.english: He hasn't guessed wrong yet, but if he does, he gets dunked.
sentences.chinese: 他還沒有猜錯，但如果他這樣做，他得到扣籃。

sentences.english: Jordan gave the audience a treat with a flurry of high-flying dunks.
sentences.chinese: 喬丹一連串的高空扣籃令觀衆大飽眼福。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
lit. one hundred shots, one hundred hits/to carry out a task with great precision/to shoot with unfailing accuracy/be a crack shot (idiom)
to have a pair of prescription glasses made
